column2: This man is a Warrior Priest of Sigmar.
One of the pretenders have declared war on this character citing their rightful claim to the Empire! It is time we join the fray and teach that insolent cur who the REAL lord of the Empire is!
Reform the Emperor's personal bodyguard, the Reiksguard
You have somehow managed to get more than one Runefang and because you are generous, you can choose to redistribute them to their rightful owners.

While Halflings aren't seen to be an especially religious people, their only holiday of note, Pie Week, is notable for its near-universal observance among the Halflings of the Moot. If you invite the best pie-makers froun around the moot and invite your vassals, this year's Pie Week jubilee will be one to be remembered!

Since 1359 IC, the three major cults of Ulric, Sigmar and Taal have been vying for supremacy within the Empire through the use of Imperial Claimants. But now, they have been humbled by the Vampire Wars, and are forced to work together if they are to survive the advance of the Undead Hordes.

Since 1359 IC, the three major cults of Ulric, Sigmar and Taal have been vying for supremacy within the Empire through the use of Imperial Claimants. However, the Empire has finally united under one banner and as a sign of peace to further prosperity, they have reformed.

Since 1359 IC, the three major cults of Ulric, Sigmar and Taal have been vying for supremacy within the Empire through the use of Imperial Claimants. But now, they have been humbled by the Chaos Hordes, and are forced to work together if they are to survive the Black Crusade.
We must to stop the threat at all cost!
We must to stop the threat at all cost! Plead to Bretonnia.

The Undead Hordes have pushed the Imperial Claimants to humility, forced to send an envoy to your realm with pleas of assistance against the threat of the Undead Hordes and dire implications of what would happen should they break the imperial lines...\n Your advisors push you to accept the alliance to stop the advance before they can pose a threat to your own borders.

An envoy from your rival to the Imperial Throne has arrived at your court pleading for an alliance to stop the undead menace that threatens both of your realms. \n Your Advisors remind you that should you win the war against the Undead, the rivalry between the two of you would surely continue afterwards. Perhaps it would be in your best interest to let them fend for themselves.
The Empire is fragmented, but you are both renowned and pious enough that both the nobles and clergy might flock to you. Do you wish to publicize your claim to the throne?

Word quickly spreads - has a child of the Empire finally become a worthy heir to Sigmar? From early reports, the peasants and clergy are supporting your claim, now you must await word from the Elector Counts and other lords...
This person, loved and respected by both the peasants and clergy, has made a push for end of division and for the Empire to unite around their person. Do you support their claim?
No, I'll never bend the knee to this usurper!
You have sworn to serve the new Emperor, and therefore, your contender title must be destroyed.
My liege - I ask you to forgive my part in the recent troubles, and pray that a new era of unity and glory awaits us under your wise leadership.
Well said. Let all old divisions be settled.
You have announced your rejection of this false new Emperor, but some of your vassals are not pleased...
I would rather see the Empire fall into ruin than bend the knee to you! I shall see you on the battlefield, foul usurper.
While riding through the woods you encounter a man, badly injured, resting against a tree. From his clothes you can tell that here is a Warrior Priest of Sigmar.
I always wanted a pet priest...
Send some men with him and pay for a doctor.

One evening in your chambers you hear someone opening your door. Your friend enters but something is amiss. He is wearing all his battle gear but before you can ask what is going on he is coming at you with his hammer!
The Warrior Priest you met in the woods has come before and offers you his gratitude and service so that he may repay your kindness.
Your former friend has turned on you along with the rest of the castle and you are forced to flee from his wrath.
Another of the pretenders have joined the war on your side hoping to halt the aggressors ambition!

Following the Vampire Wars, the vampiric usurpers have at last been driven from the Empire of Sigmar. The Elector-Count of Stirland has claimed Sylvania as part of their domains and since no one else is foolish enough to want the cursed land, there has been no opposition.
You have been chosen as the Reiksmarshal of the Empire by your liege. It is a great honor and the sword that comes with it is legendary.
The ruler of the Empire has decided to name you [From.GetHerHis] personal champion, truly a great honor!
You are a Sigmarite [This.GetTitle] and therefore the Cult of Sigmar has relinquished the legendary warhammer of Sigmar Heldenhammer so that you can wield it into battle.
Death to the enemies of the Empire!
This is the most glorious day in my life!

Your [GetFromRelation] has come before you, requesting to join the Reiksguard. Allowing this would surely bring prestige to your house, but you will have to pay for proper weapons, armor, a mount, heraldry, a retinue...
Bah, [From.GetSheHe] would probably just embarass me.
Your [GetFromRelation] has served for some time in the Reiksguard and now returns home, but [From.GetHerHis] scars show proof that it has been a hard life.
Your [GetFromRelation] has returned after serving with the Reiksguard but something has changed. [From.GetSheHeCap] no longer seems interested in the usual individuals they meet in the court.

A group of riders approached your gate this morning, telling a gruesome tale. During a skirmish with some Greenskins, your [GetFromRelation] was captured and when they mounted a rescue the next day, they found [From.GetHerHim] crippled. Apparently the boss wanted to leave a message.

Your [GetFromRelation] has come home from the Reiksguard unscathed, truly a rarity. The respect of [From.GetHerHis] soldiers escorting [From.GetHerHim] back are clear for all to see. Your [GetFromRelation] has become a true leader.
I knew you would make me proud!
After leaving the Reiksguard due to an incident involving booze, a rope and a stallion, your [GetFromRelation] has returned a troubled [From.GetManWoman], often waking screaming in the night.
Your [GetFromRelation] has returned a seasoned warrior, the tales of [From.GetHerHis] bravery are many.
A messenger arrived this evening carrying grave news. Your [GetFromRelation] has gotten [From.GetHerHim]self killed during a recent battle.
I knew I never should have allowed [From.GetHerHim] to leave.
Your [GetFromRelation] arrived this afternoon with a retinue in tow and a chest filled with gold.
I guess I should just be happy and not ask where it came from.
You send out invitations to your Pie Week jubilee.

Pie eating and revelry amongst family and friends is seen as the highest form of praise for the Halfling patron godess Esmerelda, the goddess of home and hearth. Every year, in celebration of the upcoming harvest, the Halflings of the moot celebrate Esmerelda's gifts by holding a week of celebrating and appreciating the simple joy of pie.
Invitations to the jubilee are sent.

You have been invited to join your liege, [From.GetBestName], at the Pie Week jubilee [From.GetSheHe] is hosting this year. The week-long celebration involves pie-eating contests, awards for the most delicious or most unique pie recipes, and general feasting and revelry. The holiday has understandably become one of the most widely celebrated aspects of Halfling culture and religious life outside The Moot.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused your invitation to the Pie Week jubilee, claiming [From.GetSheHe] has other plans.

The Jubilee has begun, with pies of every variety and filling occupying huge tables in the banquet hall. Songs of home and hearth are sung in thanks to Esmerelda while rivers of beer and mead flow from enormous casks in the banquet hall.
I hope I have enough room for seconds!

The jubilee of pies and drink lasts all day and night for the entire week, but all good things must end. Your vassals return home to digest, but most seem to agree that the pies and drink were worth the trip.

The jubilee of pies and drink lasts all day and night for the entire week, but all good things must end. You must return home to digest, but you and most of the other guests seem to agree that the pies and drink were worth the trip.
The preparations for this year's Pie Week begin.
Emperor [From.GetBestName] reminds you about your duty to provide the State with troops. What will be your response?
Turn your back on your Emperor.
Your vassal [From.GetBestName] will provide the Empire with [From.GetHerHis] troops in the time of need.
A traitor! Your vassal [From.GetBestName] didn't provide the Empire with troops!
This is the title granted to the commanders of the armed forces of the Empire. As such, [From.GetSheHe] holds power second only to the Emperor.
This is the chosen champion of the Empire. Mostly an honorary title, yet it holds a certain prestige.

Witch hunters have long commanded respect, the nature of their work demands it. There are hundreds of whispered tales about their deeds, some little more than legends, others terrifyingly recent. Hence the common belief in a cohesive, shadowy agency of chaos hunters, spread across the Empire and beyond. The truth of course, is far more complex.
